name: rexreplace
description: Flexible CLI regex replace in files.
author: Mathias Rangel Wulff

scripts.test: npm run test-js && npm run build && npm run test-cli
scripts.prebuild: rm -fr build && mkdir build build/ES6 && cp src/multiversion.core.js build/multiversion.core.js && cp src/multiversion.cli.js build/multiversion.cli.js && node -e "file='src/core.js';fs = require('fs');fs.writeFileSync(file,fs.readFileSync(file,'utf8').replace(/(const version = \')[^\']+/m,'\$1'+require('./package.json').version))"
scripts.build: browserify --node src/cli.js -o build/ES6/rexreplace.cli.bundle.js && browserify --node src/core.js  -o build/ES6/rexreplace.core.bundle.js
scripts.postpublish: git add --all && git commit -m v$(node -e 'console.log(require(`./package.json`).version)') && git tag v$(node -e 'console.log(require(`./package.json`).version)') && git push && git push --tag && (open https://github.com/mathiasrw/rexreplace/releases || 1)
